page.title: 08RAUNDS MANOR BRICKWORKS-Pt.1
page.content: RAUNDS MANOR BRICKWORKS is on the eastern edge of RAUNDS. They were established in 1898 and were in use until they closed down in 1975. It was originally owned by MR. G.E.SMITH who passed it on to his son MR TOM SMITH, who still owns it. The clay to make the bricks was dug from the claypits which are adjacent to the old kilns. Coal, which was used to fire the kilns, was brought in by rail on a mineral line from the station. Now that the works are no longer in use, MR SMITH would like to see the buildings knocked down and the claypits filled in to stop them being a danger to anyone. He does not want the land to be built on and he would like to see it become an area for wildlife, in particular a bird sanctuary.
